item.title: Re: On Ronin Missions
item.content:encoded:
I concur, but would like to propose the idea that, instead of a first come, first serve system, I think that a few high level Jonins and Sannins should "scout them out" so to speak, so that we know the difficulty of them and such. That way, we don't send Chunin's and Sp. Jonin's out there to get mauled by a mission with a difficulty way above their ability.

After that, I think you should set some requirements as to how high leveled someone should be for leaving for Ronin missions (so that those who are clearly too weak don't take up a slot instead of someone who could use it).

For those who meet the requirement, then it should be first come, first serve. I just think we should take steps to make sure that the lower leveled aren't wasting time on a mission that they can't complete, while the higher leveled are waiting to try it.

item.title: On Ronin Missions
item.content:encoded:
So, there's currently a rumor going around that the Ronin missions are going to be coming out soon. Very little is known about these, other than the fact that you can only do them when you're not in a Village. From what's currently been suggested, Ronin will take approximately 5 days outside of your Village, and you'll only really need to do it once (after the first time, everything significant should loop, is my understanding). I imagine all (or at least most) of you will want to do these missions at least once. However, we also don't want the Village to completely fall apart for 5 days while everyone leaves the Village to go do the Ronin missions.

So, I was thinking…maybe we should setup a system where only 3 or 4 people at a time could be officially out for Ronin missions? That is, 3 or 4 people could leave for Ronin and we'd save a spot for them to come back. Anyone, of course, is free to leave whenever they want, but if you don't get the official okay, we wouldn't save a spot for you to return (though, if there is one, you'd be welcome to return, of course). This way, the Village could maintain it's 45+ people necessary for purchasing upgrades, and we can slowly move people through the Ronin missions so they can get the benefits. My thought was we'd have a waiting list (first come, first serve) for people to go Ronin, and we just go through the list as quickly as we can.

However, I'm open to discussion on this, if anyone has any ideas as to how to handle this better? (Keeping in mind that we don't really know how it's all going to work out yet).
